briefdescription.para: Install the best available CPU kernels for this process.

detaileddescription.para: Selects optimized implementations based on runtime CPU feature detection and updates an internal dispatch table. Safe to call multiple times; last call wins.

parameterdescription.para: Non-zero to allow selecting AVX2/FMA-optimized paths.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *W, const float *x, float *y, size_t rows, size_t cols, const float *bias, size_t blk_k)
memberdef.name: ie_gemv_f32

detaileddescription.para: Computes a matrix-vector product using the best installed implementation.

Layout:
Default is row-major: W is rows*cols floats, each row contiguous.
Some kernels also accept a "blocked-K contiguous" interpretation per row; pass blk_k to describe the block size. Passing 0 disables blocking.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to weights (row-major or compatible packed layout).
Optional bias vector (length rows) or NULL.
Column block size for blocked-K layout; 0 for plain row-major.

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint16_t *W_bf16, const float *x, float *y, size_t rows, size_t cols, const uint16_t *bias_bf16)
memberdef.name: ie_gemv_bf16_f32

briefdescription.para: GEMV with BF16 weights and FP32 activations.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, non-zero on invalid args.

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8_t *W_q4, const uint8_t *W_scales, size_t scale_bytes, const float *x, float *y, size_t rows, size_t cols, const uint16_t *bias_bf16)
memberdef.name: ie_gemv_q4_0_f32

briefdescription.para: GEMV with Q4_0 weights and FP32 activations.

detaileddescription.para:
W_q4
Q4 blocks (row-major).
W_scales
Q4 scales (row-major, BF16 or FP8).
scale_bytes
Bytes per scale element (1 or 2).
x
FP32 input vector.
y
FP32 output vector.
rows
Rows.
cols
Cols.
bias_bf16
Optional BF16 bias or NULL.
0 on success, non-zero on invalid args.
GEMV with Q4_0 weights and FP32 activations.
The dispatch decision is cached after the first call. This avoids the need to modify global kernel initialization routines and ensures the symbol always resolves at link time.

briefdescription.para: Initialize log2(u8, q3) LUT for Q4 kernels (generic path).
Initialize log2(u8, q3) LUT for Q4 kernels (AVX2 path).

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8_t *W_q4, const float *W_scales, const float *x, float *y, size_t rows, size_t cols, const uint16_t *bias_bf16)
memberdef.name: ie_gemv_q4_0_f32_fscale

briefdescription.para: GEMV with Q4_0 weights and predecoded FP32 scales.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, non-zero on invalid args.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *W, const int8_t *x_q, float *y, size_t rows, size_t cols, const float *bias, size_t blk_k, ie_act_i8_params params, int symmetric)
memberdef.name: ie_gemv_qi8_f32

briefdescription.para: GEMV with per-tensor INT8 activations (fused dequantization).

detaileddescription.para: Interprets activations with the affine model: real = scale * (q - zero_point) Implementations may fuse dequantization into the dot product or dequantize into a temporary float buffer depending on ISA.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *W, const int8_t *x_q, float *y, size_t rows, size_t cols, const float *bias, size_t blk_k, size_t group_size, const float *scales, const int8_t *zeros, int symmetric)
memberdef.name: ie_gemv_qi8pg_f32

briefdescription.para: GEMV with per-group INT8 activations (blockwise parameters).

detaileddescription.para: Each group of group_size elements uses its own (scale, zero_point): g = index / group_size real = scales[g] * (q - zeros[g])

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *W, const uint8_t *x_fp8, float *y, size_t rows, size_t cols, const float *bias, size_t blk_k, ie_fp8_format fmt)
memberdef.name: ie_gemv_qfp8_f32

briefdescription.para: GEMV with FP8 activations (software decode, fused).

detaileddescription.para: Decodes FP8 bytes (E4M3 or E5M2) on the fly while accumulating the dot product.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *Q, const float *K, const float *V, size_t seq_len, size_t heads, size_t head_dim, float inv_sqrt_d, float *out, float *scratch)
memberdef.name: ie_attn_cpu_causal_f32

detaileddescription.para: Computes per-head softmax(QK^T * inv_sqrt_d) V over seq_len tokens.

Layout:
Q and out are [heads, head_dim] flattened (head_dim fastest).
K and V are [seq_len, heads, head_dim] flattened (head_dim fastest).
scratch must have length >= seq_len (floats) and is reused per head.

0 on success, non-zero on invalid args.
Causal self-attention (FP32 reference).

parameterdescription.para: Number of cached tokens to attend over (>= 1).

simplesect.para: 0 on success, non-zero on invalid args.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *W_gate, const float *W_up, const float *W_down, const float *x, size_t in_dim, size_t hidden_dim, size_t out_dim, const float *b_gate, const float *b_up, const float *b_down, float *out, float *tmp_gate, float *tmp_up)
memberdef.name: ie_mlp_cpu_swiglu_f32

detaileddescription.para: gate = W_gate * x + b_gate up = W_up * x + b_up act = silu(gate) * up out = W_down * act + b_down
W_* are row-major matrices.
tmp_gate and tmp_up must have length >= hidden_dim.

0 on success, non-zero on invalid args.
SwiGLU MLP forward (FP32 reference).
Shapes: x: [in_dim] W_gate: [hidden_dim, in_dim] W_up: [hidden_dim, in_dim] W_down: [out_dim, hidden_dim] tmp_gate: [hidden_dim] tmp_up: [hidden_dim] out: [out_dim]
Bias pointers may be NULL.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, non-zero on invalid args.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *x, const float *w, size_t n, float eps, float *y)
memberdef.name: ie_rmsnorm_cpu_f32

detaileddescription.para: Computes: y[i] = x[i] * w[i] / sqrt(mean(x^2) + eps)
This is the reference CPU implementation used by the GPT-OSS orchestration. Implementations may be swapped by the build in the future, but the signature is stable for the runtime.

x
Input vector (length n).
w
Weight vector (length n).
n
Number of elements.
eps
Epsilon added to the mean square before sqrt.
y
Output vector (length n). May alias x for in-place behavior.
0 on success, negative on invalid args.
RMSNorm (FP32) for a single vector.

This function performs:
mean-square accumulation with a double accumulator for improved stability,
a single sqrtf and reciprocal,
per-element scaling by the provided weight vector.
The function is designed to be allocation-free and deterministic. It does not attempt SIMD vectorization; higher-performance backends may be added later.

parameterdescription.para: Per-channel scale vector of length n.
Number of elements in x and w.
Small epsilon added inside the sqrt for numerical stability.
Output vector of length n (may alias x).

simplesect.para: 0 on success, non-zero on invalid arguments.

memberdef.argsstring: (float *q, float *k, size_t heads, size_t head_dim, uint32_t pos, float theta)
memberdef.name: ie_rope_apply_f32

briefdescription.para: Apply Rotary Positional Embedding (RoPE) to Q and K for a single position.

detaileddescription.para: This function applies RoPE on the first head_dim elements, interpreted as interleaved pairs (even, odd): (x0, x1) -> (x0*cos - x1*sin, x0*sin + x1*cos)
The caller passes Q and K shaped as [heads, head_dim] flattened.

parameterdescription.para: Head dimension (must be even for paired rotation).

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative on invalid args.

detaileddescription.para:
v
Input/output vector.
n
Number of elements.
fast_tanh
Non-zero to use a fast approximation; zero to use tanhf().
Vector tanh on fp32 data (in-place).
If fast_tanh != 0, uses ie_fast_tanhf; otherwise uses libm tanhf. Output values are clamped to [-1, 1] in both modes to satisfy strict bounds.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the vector (length n). Modified in-place.
Non-zero to use the fast approximation; 0 to use libm.

detaileddescription.para:
x
Input value.
Approximated tanh(x).
Fast scalar tanh approximation.

For large |x| we short-circuit to +/-1.0f. For moderate |x| we use a small rational function that gives a smooth S-curve: tanh(x) x * (27 + x^2) / (27 + 9 x^2) Finally, the result is clamped to [-1, 1] to guarantee range correctness.
